This November: Statewide tour to promote fair elections!
  


Georgia Fair Elections Tour

Friday, Nov. 10 - McDonough
Tuesday, Nov. 14 - Valdosta
Wednesday, Nov. 15 - Albany
Thursday, Nov. 16 - Savannah

FIGHT FOR FAIR ELECTIONS IN GEORGIA

Join us this month as the ACLU of Georgia and Common Cause Georgia continue our statewide tour to promote fair elections through creating impartial legislative district lines.

"Voters should pick their leaders rather than politicians picking their voters, a practice that we have been fighting since the 1960's" said Andrea Young, ACLU of Georgia executive director. "We will continue to fight to create district lines throughout the state that are fair to all voters."

Join us in a city near you for an evening of political engagement and empowerment.

Friday, November 10 - McDonough
Tour: 6:30-8:30 p.m. at Sports Bar 81

Tuesday, November 14 - Valdosta
Meet & greet: 4:30-6:30 p.m. at Big Nick's on Baytree
Tour: 6:30-8:30 p.m. at Valdosta State University

Wednesday, November 15 - Albany
Meet & greet: 4:30-6:30 p.m. at Manor Pub House
Tour: 6:30-8:30 p.m. at Albany Civil Rights Institute

Thursday, November 16 - Savannah
Tour: 6:30-8:30 p.m. at Ralph Mark Gilbert Civil Rights Museum
Meet & greet: 8-9 p.m. at Congress Street Social Club

Visit our website for details on our Georgia Fair Elections Tour stops.

We will focus on the problems that unfair district lines create for you, your family, and community. We will share solutions at both the state and local levels and tips for how you can protect democracy in your own community.

Together we will continue building momentum for nonpartisan redistricting reforms to ensure fair maps and equal representation for all Georgians ahead of the next nationwide round of drawing legislative district maps in 2022.

We hope to see you on this leg of the tour!
